main event: A single bright, silver, reddish, and green object was observed at the Glasgow AFB in Montana on August 28, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed to an elevation of 10 degrees, moved at a fast speed to the north, then stopped and moved to the east for 25 minutes before becoming visible for one hour and 27 minutes.
The object seemed to be moving in a circular direction at a constant speed at about 10 to 15 degrees elevation.
The object had no discernible features, exhaust trail, or sound.
Multiple reliable observers, including a pilot, tower operator, and combat alert center operator, witnessed the sighting.
No weather balloons or radar contacts were reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: A single bright, silver, reddish, and green object
witnesses: Capt. Hubert R. Martin, Lt. William T. Schroedter, Edward L. Schmitt, and ADC Jesse J. Allen
